<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28" lineLink="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga209de0bceb13179a973c6a45211617bd"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga209de0bceb13179a973c6a45211617bd">LLVMBool</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; Opaque types. &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; LLVM uses a polymorphic type hierarchy which C cannot represent, therefore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; parameters must be passed as base types. Despite the declared types, most</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; of the functions provided operate only on branches of the type hierarchy.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; The declared parameter names are descriptive and specify which type is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; required. Additionally, each type hierarchy is documented along with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; functions that operate upon it. For more detail, refer to LLVM&#39;s C++ code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; If in doubt, refer to Core.cpp, which performs parameter downcasts in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; form unwrap&lt;RequiredType&gt;(Param).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; Used to pass regions of memory through LLVM interfaces.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; @see llvm::MemoryBuffer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
